definition: surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
to see what is right and act courageously (idiom, from Analects); to stand up bravely for the truth/acting heroically in a just cause
March of the Volunteer Army (PRC National Anthem)
pinyin: Yi4 yong3 jun1 Jin4 xing2 qu3

sentences.english: He acted heroically saving the child from drowning.
sentences.chinese: 他見義勇爲地拯救落水兒童。

sentences.english: Among the dead was Laith Misha'an, the leader of the local pro-government Sunni militia.
sentences.chinese: 其中一名遇難者爲當地支持政府派遜尼派義勇軍領袖。

sentences.english: The picture shows the volunteers in training.
sentences.chinese: 圖爲義勇軍的訓練場景。

sentences.english: Everyone admires his spirit of doing boldly what is righteous.
sentences.chinese: 人人都讚美他這種見義勇爲的精神。

sentences.english: The paramount problem for legitimating such a type of actions is to give them a clear definition.
sentences.chinese: 見義勇爲法律化的首要問題是對之應有一明確的界定。

sentences.english: His spirit of being ready to take up the cudgels for a just cause is commendable.
sentences.chinese: 他那種見義勇爲的精神是難能可貴的。

sentences.english: The hobbits then muster a voluntary militia force in which they fight back the occupiers.
sentences.chinese: 霍比人於是聚集起了一支義勇軍抵抗佔領者。

sentences.english: Chapter 4 The idea of perfecting the law.
sentences.chinese: 第四章見義勇爲行爲立法完善的構想。

sentences.english: Why is he dressed like a Revolutionary War minuteman ?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼他穿着像革命戰爭義勇兵？

sentences.english: The fourth chapter is the present situation of Administrative Law adjusting the act of Good Samaritan.
sentences.chinese: 第四章是見義勇爲行政法調整的現狀。

definition: Huanghuagang (Chrysanthemum Hill) in Guangzhou, scene of disastrous uprising of 23rd April 1911
Changting county level city in Longyan 龍岩|龙岩, Fujian
to be involved in politics/participation in politics
Xiaoyi county level city in Lüliang 呂梁|吕梁[Lu:3 liang2], Shanxi 山西
Shu Han (c. 200-263), Liu Bei's kingdom in Sichuan during the Three Kingdoms, claiming legitimacy as successor of Han
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
